intro: Cerastium malyi f. neolindtneri, commonly known as the Neolindtner's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized flora species.
